article.headline: Hampton 65, N. Carolina A&amp,T 55
article.story: GREENSBORO, N.C. -- Kwame Morgan came off the bench to score 13 points and Hampton beat North Carolina A&T 65-55 on Monday night. Michael Freeman had a double-double with 11 points and 11 rebounds for the Pirates (5-12, 2/3 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference), who snapped a two-game losing streak. Darrien Pellum and Charles Funches each scored 10 points for the Pirates. Leading 8-7, the Pirates went on a 28-11 run to take their biggest lead of the game at 36-18 with 3:02 to play in the first half. A 3-pointer by Morgan capped the run. The lead never dipped below eight points the rest of the game. Dwane Joshua had a game-high 18 points, Thomas Coleman added 16 and Tavarus Alston had 10 for the Aggies (5-13, 1-4), who lost their fourth straight. The previous three losses each were decided by seven points or less.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
